meanings.definition: A flat, ring-shaped object thrown in a game of quoits.
meanings.sent1: During the game, players aim to toss the quoit onto the target.
meanings.sent2: The children played with a colorful quoit in the backyard.
meanings.sent3: Sarah accidentally threw the quoit onto the roof, causing everyone to laugh.
meanings.sent4: His wedding ring slipped off his finger and rolled away like a quoit.
meanings.sent5: The golden quoit gleamed in the sunlight as it spun through the air.

meanings.definition: To throw a quoit in a game.
meanings.sent1: He will quoit the ring towards the target with precision.
meanings.sent2: Players take turns to quoit the metal ring onto the stake.
meanings.sent3: She tried to quoit the rubber ring, but it bounced back unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: The skilled athlete can quoit the quoit further than anyone else.
meanings.sent5: With a swift motion, he quoited the quoit across the field effortlessly.

meanings.definition: A game in which players throw quoits at a stake in the ground.
meanings.sent1: The family gathered in the backyard to play a friendly game of quoits.
meanings.sent2: In the traditional quoit game, the closest ring to the stake wins.
meanings.sent3: The competitive friends turned the quoit game into a hilarious competition.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the metal quoits hitting the stake echoed through the park.
meanings.sent5: The champion celebrated his victory by proudly displaying the winning quoit.
